required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predictive Value of Heart Rate Variability on Cardiorespiratory Events
clinical_study.official_title: Predictive Value of Heart Rate Variability on Cardiorespiratory Events of Preterm Infants Routinely Immunised in the Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study are to investigate whether heart rate variability (HRV) parameters derived from nonlinear time series analysis at five different time points have prognostic utility for assessing the risk of postimmunisation AOP in very preterm/very low birth weight infants immunised in the hospital.

primary_outcome.time_frame: record the sum of AOP events from 48 hours windows of raw data, within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation
primary_outcome.description: Difference in AOP events within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: record SpO2 from 48 hours windows of raw data, within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in prolonged hypoxaemic episodes (SpO2 < 80% for at least 1 min) within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation (CAP-trial definition).

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in number of manual stimulations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: number of manual stimulations within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in number of manual stimulations within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in number increases in oxygen concentration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: record oxygen concentration from 48 hours windows of raw data, within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in number increases in oxygen concentration within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in number of increases in continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in number of increases in continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in number of reinstallations in continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in number of reinstallations in continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in number of endotracheal intubation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in number of endotracheal intubation for AOP events within 24 hours after - 24 hours before immunisation

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in sample entropy (SampEn) of interbeat interval of heart rate (IBI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after - immediately prior to immunisation
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in SampEn of IBI 24 hours after - immediately prior to immunisation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: preterm infants measured at 37 to 42 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in SampEn of IBI in preterm infants measured at 37 to 42 weeks postconceptional age vs. SampEn of IBI in term healthy control infants

clinical_study.condition: Post-immunisation Apnoea and Bradycardia of Prematurity (AOP)

arm_group.description: preterm infants will be routinely immunised during primary hospitalisation
preterm infants discharged and readmitted for immunisation during the 3-year period

intervention.description: combined diphtheria, tetanus, acellular pertussis, poliomyelitis, hepatitis B, ± Haemophilus influenzae type B and simultaneous pneumococcus (PCV13) vaccination

study_pop.textblock: preterm infants and healthy control infants

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria for preterm infants:
- Gestational Age (GA) 22+0 to 31+6 weeks and/or birth weight 400 g to 1500 g
- Chronological age > 7 days
- Written informed parental consent
Inclusion criteria for term healthy control infants:
- GA 37 to 42 weeks, chronological age 3 to 28 days (beyond initial transition after birth)
- Hospitalised in the neonatal rooming-in unit of the University Children's Hospital Basel as healthy co-twin or healthy sibling, or neonate ready to be discharged home after reconvalescence from minor illness such as hyperbilirubinaemia
- Written informed parental consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major congenital malformations including neuromuscular disorders, thoracic malformations, major cardiac malformation
- Lack of written informed parental consent

facility.name: University Children's Hospital Basel UKBB, University of Basel
